types.section:
{{fr-verb}}

# [[had better]] [[watch out]], [[had better]] [[brace oneself]], to be [[in for]] a [[challenge]]

====Usage notes====
* Used as a warning that someone is going to come up against fierce competition and face a worthy challenger.
types.html:
n'avoir qu'à bien se tenir

  1. had better watch out, had better brace oneself, to be in for a challenge

Usage notes

[edit]
  • Used as a warning that someone is going to come up against fierce competition and face a worthy challenger.
trans: had better watch out, had better brace oneself, to be in for a challenge
had better watch out, had better brace oneself, to be in for a challenge

title: n'avoir qu'à bien se tenir
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /n‿a.vwaʁ k‿a bjɛ̃ sə t(ə).niʁ/
